Class JDoubleAttributeField

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent

                  javax.swing.JTextField
                      javax.swing.JFormattedTextField
                          org.jhotdraw.gui.JDoubleAttributeField
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.Scrollable, javax.swing.SwingConstants, AttributeField
public class JDoubleAttributeField
extends javax.swing.JFormattedTextField
implements AttributeField

An entry field that can be used to edit a Double attribute of a Figure.

The JDoubleAttributeField can either be global to all DrawingViews of a DrawingEditor, or it can be local to a single DrawingView.

In both cases, the drawing editor must be basicSet using method setEditor. To make the entry field local to a single DrawingView, the view must be basicSet using method setView. FIXME We have got many kinds of attribute fields. Factor out all reusable code.

Version:
1.0 April 22, 2007 Created.
Author:
Werner Randelshofer
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

setAttributeKey

public void setAttributeKey(AttributeKey<java.lang.Double> newValue)

setEditor

public void setEditor(DrawingEditor newValue)
Sets the drawing editor. This must be basicSet to a non-null value to make the attribute field functional.

This is a bound property. The default value is null.

getEditor

public DrawingEditor getEditor()

setView

public void setView(DrawingView newValue)
Sets the drawing view. Setting this to a non-null value, makes the attribute field local to the drawing view. Setting this to null, makes the attribute field global to all drawing views in the drawing editor.

This is a bound property. The default value is null.

getView

public DrawingView getView()
